summary: Pop/twitch feeling in arm when lifting (lateral raise/face pull) via /r/Fitness
title: Pop/twitch feeling in arm when lifting (lateral raise/face pull) via /r/Fitness
body:
I get a weird pop/twitch in my left arm when doing lateral raises or face pulls. It doesn’t happen every rep, maybe every 3 or 4. It has been on going for a while. I tried resting it for a couple of weeks but it still happens. Any ideas before I go see an orthopedic specialist?

Area of problem: http://imgur.com/gallery/TJyAPN8



Submitted February 19, 2019 at 05:09AM by josh0724
via reddit http://bit.ly/2T0Vghi

reblog.comment:

Area of problem: http://imgur.com/gallery/TJyAPN8



Submitted February 19, 2019 at 05:09AM by josh0724
via reddit http://bit.ly/2T0Vghi

summary: Oral antifungal drug used to treat yeast infections linked to higher rates of miscarriage
title: Oral antifungal drug used to treat yeast infections linked to higher rates of miscarriage
body:
While topical treatments are first line for pregnant women with fungal infections, oral fluconazole is often used during pregnancy. Researchers looked at data on 441 949 pregnancies from the Quebec Pregnancy Cohort between 1998 and 2015, linking to filled prescriptions listed in the Quebec… eCommerce web development

blog.description: ENFJ-A I'm a person from a place and I do things. Medical Lab Nerd. Phlebotimist. Violinist. Musician. Composer. BS in Horticulture. Future Dietiician. I've lost 170 lbs and kept it off for 10 years! I love cooking and making as many things homemade as I possibly can! I'm obsessed with my ginger tabby cat. Did I mention I love music? I LOVE MUSIC!

summary: Fear of image, fear of disease. It’s an instinct to want control but the experience we give ourselves in achieving our goals...
body:
Fear of image, fear of disease.

It’s an instinct to want control but the experience we give ourselves in achieving our goals with the health of our bodies dictates how successful we’ll be in the long term.

It comes down to emotional well-being and a shift in your mindset. You can eat the correct number of calories, follow a workout program–and not to go Marie Kondo on you, but until you do that in a way that sparks joy you’ll often find yourself feeling suffocated, overwhelmed, and even worsen your emotional well-being to the point of cyclical sabotage.

So. What the Heck? I’m trying to be healthy!

Think about it differently. Food has value, not just nutritional value. Are you eating food or are you eating macronutrients and micronutrients? Give yourself experiences. Eat with friends and family. Try new cuisines. Make food. Make food with friends! Does the way you experience your food give you positive emotions?

Let’s not get it twisted.  We need a wide variety of complexly intertwined nutrients to achieve our best health outcomes. We need to move our bodies more, engage muscle groups, reduce emotional stress, feel loved, and sleep more.

But? Keep asking yourself, what experience is this giving me? Does the way I’m doing this actually make me feel better? 

How are you experiencing the time between meals and workouts? Are you riddled with fears and anxiety? Are you continuously thinking and planning? Picking and prodding yourself to pieces? Have you ever asked yourself–do I like this? Am I having fun?

Yes! It matters!

Fun over fear.

caption:
#Repost @alkaline_electric_water #environment #earth #plastic #health #water #waterways #rivers #stream #ocean
#plasticfree・・・
Evil is winning 😣 #hemp Repost By @earthlingmcginn: 🔥Plastic waste is one of many types of wastes that take too long to decompose. Normally, plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose in landfills. But plastic bags we use in our everyday life take 10-1000 years to decompose, while plastic bottles can take 450 years or more.
▪️Since the 1950s, around 8.3 billion tons of plastic have been produced worldwide. That’s equivalent to the weight of more than 800,000 Eiffel Towers.
▪️And only 9% of it has been recycled.
▪️A report by the Guardian found that 1 million plastic bottles are bought around the world every minute, and this number is set to increase by another 20% by 2021 if we don’t act.
▪️The same report said more than 480 billion plastic drinking bottles were purchased in 2016 across the world up from 300 billion a decade ago.
▪️Additionally, less than half of the bottles purchased in 2016 were recycled — with just 7% of those collected turned into new bottles, and the rest ending up in landfill sites or the ocean.
▪️Worldwide, about 2 million plastic bags are used every minute.
▪️This might seem like an unbelievable number, but according to Ecowatch, between 500 billion and 1 trillion plastic bags are used worldwide annually.
▪️ The average time that a plastic bag is used for is 12 minutes. Yep, that’s right they’re used for an average of 12 minutes and then take up to 1 thousand years to decompose.
https://www.instagram.com/p/BuEJAHLnhV2/?utm_source=ig_tumblr_share&igshid=1dsrfjmhvf5lh

blog.name: melodyshealthylife
blog.title: Melody's Healthy Life
blog.description:
Hi I'm Melody! I'm starting this blog to share my commitment to fitness and a healthy lifestyle. All of the pictures on my blog are ones that I have taken myself.
Canadian Born and Raised (:
Healthy Lifestyle Beginnings: June 3rd, 2016
Blog Creation: May 1st, 2017
Started Yoga: September 2016
Started Pilates: January 27, 2018

 



     visits as of October 17, 2017

summary:
3 Reasons You Should Lift Weights on a Regular Basis
    Why might you want to lift weights on a regular basis?  There's lots...
caption:
3 Reasons You Should Lift Weights on a Regular Basis

Why might you want to lift weights on a regular basis? There’s lots of valid motives for doing so. Inertia is the most common reason for not considering it. Scarcity of good info is sometimes the reason. At other times fear of the unknown is the cause. Often it is not know how and not…

Read the full article by clicking HERE
